name: GetEnvironmentInsights
description:
Retrieve insights for a specific environment.

Use this tool to get insights for a specified environment within a given project. It logs each view upon retrieval.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project to access. Use /api/projects/ to find the correct ID.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: created_by_user_id
parameters.description: The user ID of who created the insight. Expected as an integer.

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description: Specify the format of the retrieved insights (csv or json).

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page for pagination.

value_schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: initial_result_index
parameters.description: The initial index from which to start returning results.

value_schema.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: refresh_method
parameters.description: Strategy for refreshing insights, with options for cache use and sync/async execution. Choices include: 'force_cache', 'blocking', 'async', 'lazy_async', 'force_blocking', and 'force_async'.

value_schema.description:
Whether to refresh the retrieved insights, how aggresively, and if sync or async:
- `'force_cache'` - return cached data or a cache miss; always completes immediately as it never calculates
- `'blocking'` - calculate synchronously (returning only when the query is done), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'async'` - kick off background calculation (returning immediately with a query status), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'lazy_async'` - kick off background calculation, UNLESS there are somewhat fresh results in the cache
- `'force_blocking'` - calculate synchronously, even if fresh results are already cached
- `'force_async'` - kick off background calculation, even if fresh results are already cached
Background calculation can be tracked using the `query_status` response field.

parameters.name: short_identifier
parameters.description: The short identifier for the environment to retrieve insights for. This is unique per environment.

parameters.name: return_basic_insight_metadata_only
parameters.description: Set to true to return only basic metadata without results for faster response.

value_schema.description: Return basic insight metadata only (no results, faster).

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: basic
parameters.description: Return basic insight metadata only (no results, faster).

value_schema.description: Return basic insight metadata only (no results, faster).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

value_schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

value_schema.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description:
Whether to refresh the retrieved insights, how aggresively, and if sync or async:
- `'force_cache'` - return cached data or a cache miss; always completes immediately as it never calculates
- `'blocking'` - calculate synchronously (returning only when the query is done), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'async'` - kick off background calculation (returning immediately with a query status), UNLESS there are very fresh results in the cache
- `'lazy_async'` - kick off background calculation, UNLESS there are somewhat fresh results in the cache
- `'force_blocking'` - calculate synchronously, even if fresh results are already cached
- `'force_async'` - kick off background calculation, even if fresh results are already cached
Background calculation can be tracked using the `query_status` response field.

value_schema.description:
